title: Linux losetup Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux losetup command with practical examples. Learn how to create, attach, and detach loopback devices, a useful tool for working with disk images and file systems.

meta.title: Linux losetup Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux losetup command with practical examples. Learn how to create, attach, and detach loopback devices, a useful tool for working with disk images and file systems.
meta.keywords: Linux, losetup, loopback device, disk image, file system, disk utilities

verify.name: Verify losetup -a output
verify.hint: The `losetup -a` command should display the currently active loopback devices on your system. If no loopback devices are found, please check the output of the command and try again.

verify.name: Verify loopback device creation
verify.hint: The `losetup -a` command should display the `/dev/loop0` device attached to the `~/project/disk.img` file. If the loopback device is not found, please check the output of the command and try again.

steps.title: Attaching and Detaching a Loopback Device

verify.name: Verify loopback device detachment
verify.hint: The `losetup -a` command should not display the `/dev/loop0` device attached to the `~/project/disk.img` file after running the `sudo losetup -d /dev/loop0` command. If the loopback device is still attached, please check the output of the command and try again.

verify.name: Verify loopback device reattachment
verify.hint: The `losetup -a` command should display the `/dev/loop0` device attached to the `~/project/disk.img` file after running the `sudo losetup /dev/loop0 ~/project/disk.img` command. If the loopback device is not reattached, please check the output of the command and try again.
